description: From Ancient Greek μεθοδικός (methodikós, “going to work by rule, systematic, crafty”)  +‎ -al.

adjectives.description: methodical (comparative more methodical, superlative most methodical)

entries.meaning: In an organized manner; proceeding with regard to method; systematic.
Arranged with regard to method; disposed in a suitable manner, or in a manner to illustrate a subject, or to facilitate practical observation.
examples: the methodical arrangement of arguments; a methodical treatise
